list_definition.definition: fog mixed with smoke and fumes from factories, houses, vehicles etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Some big cities have a problem with smog.

list_ex_of_english: This is a secondary pollutant formed when nitrogen oxides mix with hydrocarbons from vehicle exhausts in the presence of sunlight—the infamous photochemical smog.
The effect that we call acid rain is a photochemical smog created by a combination of sulphur dioxide, nitrogen oxide, hydrocarbons and ozone.
These are the manifestations which the public recognise as "photo-chemical smog".
Methane found in the atmosphere is mostly consumed by photochemical smog.
Our own scientists have now found photo-chemical smog not in towns but in the countryside.
Whether people are shop stewards, factory managers or members of the public, they want to get out of the smog and pollution of city environment.
To them, acid rain and urban smog are more immediate and urgent concerns than global warming.
There, gridlock occurs now on an almost daily basis and the city swelters under an ever present cloak of photochemical smog.
